page.title: 01A Country Corner of Carrick
page.content: This sparsly populated area straddles the parishes of Crosshill and Straiton and comprises the estate of Kirkbride. part of the Blairquhan estate, scattered family farms and Forestry Commission land. Obvious signs of human habitation are Kirkbride House, part of the Blairquhan boundary wall Crosshill cenetry, a privately owned lumber mill at Balsaggart and a few farms. The farms produce sheep, beef cattle and winter fed for the animals turnips, hay. Marginal activities include small scale egg production and pony rearing. A few residential decideous trees remain from the hay-day of the estates, but the majority of the trees are coniferous, produced as cash crops. Pheasants abound on both estates providing a source if income to the owners during the shooting season. Primary school
